page.title: 06Education in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: The only school in Bwlchysarnau is a county primary school built in 1870 which caters for pupils from the ages of 4 to 11. At present there is a Head teacher, assistant teacher and 15 pupils of mixed ages and ability. This school has been under threat of closure for the past 6 years, due to its small roll but it is considered a special case as it is situated in the middle of a large rural area, with the nearest alternative schools at least 10 miles away. Along with the church it performs an important function as a focus for the scattered community and the teachers try to involve the pupils with the envoironment and the residents. At the age of 11 pupils transfer to Llanidloes HighSchool, 10 miles away involving a \ hour bus trip.This small comprehensive school has 500 pupils.
